槓.definition: coffin-bearing pole (old); thick pole; bar; rod; thick line; to mark with a thick line; to sharpen (a knife, razor etc); to get into a dispute with; standard; criterion; hyphen; dash

槓上.definition: to get into a dispute with

槓刀.definition: to sharpen a knife (or razor etc)

槓桿.definition: lever; pry bar; crowbar; financial leverage

槓頭.definition: (old) chief coffin bearer; (fig.) argumentative person; a kind of bread made with a dough flattened using a rolling pin 槓子|杠子[gang4 zi5]

槓龜.definition: (Tw) to lose one's shirt (gambling); to meet with failure (from Taiwanese 摃龜, Tai-lo pr. [kòng-ku])
